newsitem.title: USA: Two teens questioned after Central Park killing.
newsitem.headline: Two teens questioned after Central Park killing.

text.p: Police arrested two 15-year-olds Friday after the body of a man was found floating in a Central Park lake with his throat slashed.

Police said they believed the teens, a boy and a girl, had been rollerblading in the park after midnight when they met the man and started drinking with him. The teenagers and the victim, a man in his 40s, all knew each other, police said.
They said an argument apparently broke out after the older man put his arm around the girl.
The body of the unidentified man was found floating in the lake at about 3 a.m. EDT Friday by police after they had received an emergency call.

Both 15-year-olds were arrested at their homes in the comfortable Upper West Side neighbourhood of Manhattan that adjoins Central Park. They are both being questioned and have not been charged. A weapon was recovered, police said.
